intro: Statice lycopodioides, commonly known as the sea lavender or coastal statice, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Plumbaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and showy, blue to purple flower heads. The plant thrives in saline and well-drained soils, often found in coastal areas and dunes. Its fleshy leaves and sturdy stems help it withstand harsh maritime conditions. Statice lycopodioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
